active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between short (e.g., 7-day) and long (e.g., 6-month) CPS update notice periods as specified in CA/Browser Forum Baseline Requirements versus RFC 3647. Consider impacts on CA operations, relying parties, and overall PKI trust. Support arguments with references to standards.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert PKI flashcard generator synthesizing university-level content on 'CPS Update and Notification Procedures' (Certification Practice Statement in PKI). Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 001_Cryptography > 009_Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) > 006_002_Trust Models and Relationships > Certification Practice Statement > CPS Update and Notification Procedures. Base content STRICTLY on corrected PKI context: RFC 3647 (CPS structure/amendments), CA/Browser Forum Baseline Requirements (notifications: 7-30 days minor, 6 months major; publish via repository/website), NIST SP 800-57 (PKI recs). Ignore Cyber-Physical Systems entirely. Incorporate: Learning Objectives [paste array above]; Active Learning [reference components]; Scaffolding Layers [use for progression, 10-15 cards per layer, total 50-75 cards covering all Bloom's levels]. Generate flashcards per Flashcard Schema [paste schema above]. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards: [{'question': '...', 'answer': '...', 'type': '...', 'options': [...], 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': 1, 'distractors': ['...', '...']}, ...]. Ensure variety: 40% basic Q&A, 40% MC, 20% cloze/application. Promote active learning by tying explanations to discussion/peer activities. High accuracy: Cite sources in explanations.
